section.title: Introduction
section.para: This documentation describes the capabilities and usage of the Ulteo OVD Native Clients.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: The OVD Native client can be installed on all Microsoft Windows version higher than Windows XP and included
It can also be installed on all Linux distribution

section.title: Installation on Microsoft Windows
section.para: Download and execute the Ulteo OVD Native Client installer, from here
Select where you want to copy the client files
The client installation is finished. You can now launch a session.

section.title: User Interface
section.para: When you start the Native Client, you have access to the login window that you will use to launch your session.
You just have to type your login and password, click the "Start!" button and you have access to OVD.

section.title: Advanced Settings
section.para: In the login window, you can also set advanced parameters by clicking the "More options ..." button.
The available options will be displayed, each one is described below.

listitem.para: Use local credentials: When enabled, the Native Client will send a request to the Session Manager containing your current machine's credentials, using for example Kerberos or NTLM. When disabled, the Native Client will send a request to the Session Manager containing the login and password entered in the login window.

Mode: This option allows you to pick which session mode you want to use.
Auto: The Session Manager will choose between a desktop session or an Application session based on the configuration .
Application: Launches a window with a list of application available. Applications are launched seamlessly.
Desktop: Launches a full desktop with applications integrated inside it.
Resolution: Choose which resolution will be used, valid for desktop sessions only.
Auto-publish shortcuts: Choose if you want to have shortcuts on your actual desktop at the session start. This option applies only when using the "application" session mode.
Language: This option allows you to pick which language your OVD session will use.
Keyboard layout: This option allows you to select which keyboard layout your local keyboard is using.

section.title: Starting a Session
section.para: When you start a session, a splash screen appears indicating that the session is loading.
Below you will find screenshots for both Desktop and Application mode.

simplesect.title: Desktop Session
simplesect.para: When the session is ready, your Desktop is available and you can launch applications, explore your files etc.

simplesect.title: Application Session
simplesect.para: When the session is ready, your Application session is available and you can launch applications seamlessly.
You can launch applications by clicking on the arrow button. You can also choose to integrate the applications shorcuts to your desktop by clicking on Display icons.

section.title: Default Configuration
section.para: When the Remember me checkbox is enabled, the current configuration is saved in a configuration file. This file is named default.conf and uses the INI syntax.

The directory used to store the configuration file depends on the system:
On Microsoft Windows systems, it's Application Data\ulteo\ovd\client
On a Linux systems, it's ~/.ulteo/ovd/client

Here is the INI tree that is used:
Section server
host, the server to connect to
port, the port to use if not the default (443)
Section user
login, the login you want to use
use-local-credentials, Can be true or false (default).
When this option is used, the login attribute is ignored.
Section session
language, specified using the IETF lang code
keymap, specified using the IETF lang code
mode, the session mode, can be applications, auto or desktop
show-progressbar, Can be true (default) or false.
Section publication
auto-publish, for applications mode only, add the application shortcuts on the Desktop and perform file associations. Can be true (default) or false.
Section screen
size, for desktop mode only. Can be 800x600, 1024x768 (default), 1280x678, maximized or fullscreen
Section gui
locked-gui, minimal interface with only login and password fields

simplesect.title: Microsoft Windows Registry
simplesect.para: On Microsoft Windows systems, it's also possible to read the default configuration from the registry by use the option --reg
The Native Client reads the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE first and then, the HKEY_CURRENT_USER tree. The path to the registry data is Software\Ulteo\OVD\NativeClient.

section.title: Single Sign-On
section.para: On Microsoft Windows system, it's possible to perform SSO connection using the local credentials.
To enable this feature, you have to check the "Use local creadential" checkbox or define it in the configuration (file or registry).

important.para: This feature requires server side configuration.
You have to use an Apache authentication module (Kerberos or NTLM) and enable the "Apache auth module" in the Administration Console.
